title: Drawing, "Design for Wall or Ceiling Decoration with Bacchus, Hymen and Venus", 1790–1800
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown and gray wash, black chalk, graphite on off-white laid paper
inscribed: Inscribed in pen and brown ink, lower center, recto: Imene Bacco e Venere; verso: perhaps written by Giani, "26" and "44."
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
description: Hymen standing, embraces Dionysos with right arm and raises torch with his left arm. At left Dionysos sits upon throne, together with lion; he leans left hand upon pitcher, supports hand thyrsos with right.  At right Venus sits, holding a wreath with each hand. Upon clouds in foreground at left, the mask of satyr, with tamborine and other musical instrument on vine.  At right, two kissing doves. Below caption: "Imene Bacco e Venere." Verso: perhaps written by Giani, "26" and "44."

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Design for Wall or Ceiling Decoration with Bacchus, Hymen and Venus", 1790–1800.
1790–1800. Pen and brown ink, brush and brown and gray wash, black chalk, graphite on off-white laid paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors. 1901-39-1806.
